reporting_cycle: The Secretary-General reports every 90 days; The Panel of Experts provides a final report by 15 July 2020 and progress updates as appropriate; The CAR authorities report by 30 June 2020
summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling previous resolutions and statements on the Central African Republic (CAR),

Welcoming efforts to reform the security sector, including deployment of CAR defence and security forces,

Noting progress on benchmarks established in April 2019,

Welcoming reports of the Secretary-General and the Panel of Experts,

Determining the situation in CAR remains a threat to international peace and security,

Acting under Chapter VII, 

1. Decides to continue measures to prevent supply, sale or transfer of arms and related materiel to CAR until 31 July 2020, 
with exemptions for:
 
(a) MINUSCA, EU training missions, French forces, and other forces providing training and assistance;
 
(b) Non-lethal equipment and assistance for CAR security forces for security sector reform (SSR);
 
(c) Supplies for Chadian or Sudanese forces in international patrols;
 
(d) Non-lethal military equipment for humanitarian or protective use;
 
(e) Protective clothing for UN personnel, media, and humanitarian workers;
 
(f) Small arms for international-led patrols and armed wildlife rangers;
 
(g) Weapons with a calibre of 14.5 mm or less and ammunition for CAR security forces for SSR;
 
(h) Arms and lethal equipment for CAR security forces for SSR, approved in advance by the Committee;
 
(i) Other sales or supply of arms and materiel, or assistance, approved in advance by the Committee.
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document 2507 (2020) without adding any extra information:

2. Decides that the supplying Member State or international organisation is primarily responsible for notifying the Committee at least 20 days in advance of delivering supplies permitted in paragraphs 1 (d), (f), and (g).

3. Renews until 31 July 2020 the measures and provisions in paragraphs 4 and 5 of resolution 2488 (2019).

4. Renews until 31 July 2020 the measures and provisions in paragraphs 9, 14, and 16 to 19 of resolution 2399 (2018).

5. Reaffirms that measures in paragraphs 9 and 16 of resolution 2399 (2018) apply to individuals and entities designated by the Committee.

6. Extends until 31 August 2020 the mandate of the Panel of Experts and requests the Secretary-General to take necessary administrative measures.

7. Requests the Panel of Experts to provide a final report by 15 July 2020 and progress updates.

8. Expresses concern about illicit trafficking networks funding armed groups in the CAR and requests the Panel to devote special attention to analysing such networks.

9. Urges cooperation with the Panel of Experts and the safety of its members.

10. Urges unhindered access for the Panel of Experts.

11. Reaffirms Committee provisions and reporting and review provisions.

12. Requests the CAR authorities to report by 30 June 2020 on progress regarding SSR, DDRR, and weapons management.

13. Requests the Secretary-General to conduct an assessment by 30 June 2020 on progress achieved by the CAR authorities.

14. Affirms that it will keep the situation in the CAR under review and be prepared to review the measures in this resolution.

15. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
